title.narrative: Agenda PERU +20 : La participation du secteur privé à l'élaboration d'initiatives - Tendances et perspectives
Agenda PERU +20: Trends and Future Perspectives of Private Sector Participation in Developing Initiatives

description.narrative:
This project will examine the relationships between the private sector, public sector, and civil society organizations on development issues. It will provide evidence-based recommendations to sustain economic growth and development in Peru.
Twenty years ago, the FORO Nacional/Internacional launched the Agenda: PERU program to strengthen democratic governance, promote institutional reform, and design development strategies in Peru. The program focused on critical issues for Peru's development and conducted studies, promoted debate and consensus, influenced policy-making, contributed to public sector institutional reform, and reached out to the general public.
Many advances were made through the Agenda: PERU program. However, 10 years of strong economic growth have made it clear that there are important challenges to sustaining both the growth and development processes. One of these challenges is to understand the private sector's important role in development initiatives and policies, particularly as it relates to its relationship with the public sector and civil society organizations.
Private sector activities have a central relevance to social, economic, and political development. The sector plays a complementary role to the social and public sectors. The influence of each of these players is an important consideration when designing development efforts or analyzing behaviours.
FORO's participatory research aims to identify the main factors and drivers for these complementary roles in the context of institutional reforms and improvements in Peru. This project will promote discussion on the issues and best practices.
The research team will prepare a discussion paper with three case studies. It will analyze the private sector's role in development strategies based on the following development issues: -Direct social responsibility -Public works tax deduction -Social enterprises -Social innovation mechanisms -Participation of the private sector in cooperation for development initiatives
The research team will share strategies for ensuring collaboration among different actors in a final report. The report will be shared on FORO's website, through social media, and at presentations in Peru.
